body.p: includes a specialized YAML editor with various editing features for files that have the yaml/yml file extension. It includes the usual text editing actions, syntax highlighting, automatic validation, and formatting and indenting. also includes a document template to help you get started with YAML documents. The template is called YAML and it can be found in the New Document folder in the New document wizardNew from templates wizard.You can experiment with a sample of a YAML file available at: [OXYGEN-INSTALL-DIR]/samples/yaml/personal.yaml.

section.title: Format and Indent YAML Documents
section.p: includes support for formatting and indenting YAML documents. You can trigger a format and indent operation for your YAML document using the Format and Indent toolbar button.

Some of the formatting actions that are performed include:
Indents the document with the indent size specified in the Editor Format preferences page.
Removes empty lines and extra spaces between keys and values.
Compacts the string values (for example, description) and limits it to 80 characters on a row.
To batch format/indent multiple YAML files, select and right-click the files in the ProjectProject Navigator view, then select Format and Indent Files.

section.title: Toggle Line Comment
section.p: In addition to the usual text editing actions being available in the YAML editor, it also includes a unique action available in the contextual menu (or by using the keyboard shortcut):

dlentry.dd: Allows you to comment (or uncomment) a line in the YAML document you are editing.
